Sixty-5's goal is to accelerate sustainable agriculture, through the provision of hardware, software & data services to the wider agricultural market for the precision management of each square metre of land.

John Arrell

CEO

Sixty-5 was originally founded by John Arrell; a experienced practitioner within the field of precision agriculture and tractor gps systems, Sixty-5 is a spin out from Progressive Agriculture Solutions a company John formed in 2011 to deliver products that increase productivity of agricultural machinery throughout Ireland. John also delivered precision agriculture services throughout Ireland including soil sampling, EMI scanning services and an RTK corrected GPS network which gave him the market credibility, knowledge and ultimately the foundation for Sixty-5.

Colin Mitchell

CTO

Sixty-5's technical co-founder is Colin Mitchel; an experienced technical director with over 35 years experience in software and electronic control. Their objective when creating the company was simple; create products and services that are easy to adopt and provide benefit to the wider agricultural community who will embrace the technology to improve their profitability and sustainability, in turn contributing to the global challenge that 65% more food will need to be produced from the same land to feed the estimated 9 billion people who will inhabit the planet by 2050.

The Future of Agriculture will rest on the acquisition, processing, utilisation of data for decision making and real-time control of machinery, by building trust with our customers over the long term, we aim to be leaders in this field.
